alert.note: Alert for Bertie; Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 7:06PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Bertie and Northampton Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 706 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Scotland Neck, or 9 miles south of Halifax, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Garysburg, Rich Square, Aulander, Woodland, Seaboard, Lewiston Woodville, Roxobel, Weldon, Jackson, Kelford, Lasker, Eagletown, Mud Castle, Republican, Bryantown, Boones Crossroads, Pleasant Grove, Pleasant Hill, George and Creeksville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
